columns.name: name
columns.description: The name of the resource that is unique within the set of outbound rules used by the load balancer. This name can be used to access the resource.

columns.name: load_balancer_name
columns.description: The friendly name that identifies the load balancer.

columns.name: provisioning_state
columns.description: The provisioning state of the outbound rule resource. Possible values include: 'ProvisioningStateSucceeded', 'ProvisioningStateUpdating', 'ProvisioningStateDeleting', 'ProvisioningStateFailed'.

columns.name: etag
columns.description: A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

columns.name: allocated_outbound_ports
columns.description: The number of outbound ports to be used for NAT.

columns.name: enable_tcp_reset
columns.description: Receive bidirectional TCP Reset on TCP flow idle timeout or unexpected connection termination. This element is only used when the protocol is set to TCP.

columns.name: idle_timeout_in_minutes
columns.description: The timeout for the TCP idle connection. The value can be set between 4 and 30 minutes. The default value is 4 minutes. This element is only used when the protocol is set to TCP.

columns.name: protocol
columns.description: The protocol for the outbound rule in load balancer. Possible values include: 'LoadBalancerOutboundRuleProtocolTCP', 'LoadBalancerOutboundRuleProtocolUDP', 'LoadBalancerOutboundRuleProtocolAll'.

columns.name: backend_address_pools
columns.description: A reference to a pool of DIPs. Outbound traffic is randomly load balanced across IPs in the backend IPs.

columns.name: frontend_ip_configurations
columns.description: The Frontend IP addresses of the load balancer.
